normal.statement: Force is defined as:

The SI unit of force is:

A body remains at rest or in uniform motion unless acted upon by an external force. This is known as:

The dimensional formula of force is:

If net external force on a body is zero, then its acceleration is:
The action and reaction forces act:

The weight of a body is the force with which it is attracted by:
A spring balance measures:

The SI unit of momentum is:

When a body is in equilibrium, the net force acting on it is:
A block is at rest on a rough surface. The friction acting on it is:
Static friction is:
Kinetic friction acts when:
options: A body just begins to move
A body is sliding over a surface
normal.answer: A body is sliding over a surface

normal.statement: The direction of frictional force is always:
The limiting value of static friction is given by:
If no external force acts on a system, its total momentum:
Action and reaction forces are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction but:
options: Cancel only if both bodies are at rest
Do not cancel as they act on different bodies
normal.answer: Do not cancel as they act on different bodies

A block of mass \( m \) slides down an inclined plane with angle \( \theta \) and friction coefficient \( \mu \). The net acceleration is:

jee.statement: A block A of mass 2 kg lies on another block B of mass 3 kg. The coefficient of friction between them is 0.4. A horizontal force of 10 N is applied to A. The acceleration of A is:

A mass slides down a frictionless incline of angle \( \theta \). The normal reaction on it is:
A mass m attached to a string rotates in a vertical circle. The tension at the lowest point is 3 times its weight. The speed at the lowest point is:
A car moves at constant speed around a circular track. Which of the following statements is correct?
options: Speed is constant but velocity changes
jee.answer: Speed is constant but velocity changes
